{{Infobox NFL player |name = Vontaze Burfict |image = Vontaze Burfict 2015.JPG |image_size = 225px |caption = Burfict with the Cincinnati Bengals in 2015 |current_team = Cincinnati Bengals |number = 55 |position = Linebacker |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1990|9|24|mf=y}} |birth_place = [[Los Angeles, California]] |height_ft = 6 |height_in = 1 |weight_lbs = 255 |high_school = [[Centennial High School (Corona, California)|Corona (CA) Centennial]] |college = [[Arizona State Sun Devils football|Arizona State]] |undraftedyear = 2012 |pastteams = * [[Cincinnati Bengals]] ({{NFL Year|2012}}–present) |status = Active |highlights = * [[Pro Bowl]] ([[2014 Pro Bowl|2013]]) * Second-team [[All-Pro]] ([[2013 All-Pro Team|2013]]) * First-team [[College Football All-America Team|All-American]] ([[2010 College Football All-America Team|2010]]) * [[Pac-12 Conference football individual awards|Pac-10 Defensive Player of the Year]] (2010) * [[Pac-12 Conference football individual awards|Pac-10 Defensive Freshman of the Year]] (2009) * ''[[USA Today]]'' High School All-American ([[2008 USA Today All-USA high school football team|2008]]) |statleague = NFL |statseason = 2017 |statweek = |statlabel1 = [[Tackle (football move)|Total tackles]] |statvalue1 = 571 |statlabel2 = [[Quarterback sack|Sacks]] |statvalue2 = 8.5 |statlabel3 = [[Interception]]s |statvalue3 = 5 |statlabel4 = [[Fumble|Forced fumbles]] |statvalue4 = 4 |statlabel5 = [[Fumble|Fumble recoveries]] |statvalue5 = 5 |statlabel6 = [[Touchdown|Defensive touchdowns]] |statvalue6 = 1 |nflnew = vontazeburfict/2533058 }}
'''Vontaze DeLeon Burfict Jr.''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|v|ɒ|n|t|ɛ|z|_|ˈ|b|ɜːr|f|ɪ|k|t}} {{respell|VON|tez|_|BUR|fikt}};<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bengals.com/team/roster/vontaze-burfict/941b89df-2666-4d9f-810e-9b889ba417eb/|title=Cincinnati Bengals: Vontaze Burfict|publisher=}}</ref> born September 24, 1990) is an [[American football]] player for the [[Cincinnati Bengals]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He was signed by the Bengals as an [[undrafted free agent]] in 2012.<ref name="Yahoo">{{cite news |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/undrafted-lb-burfict-gets-chance-182221208--nfl.html|title=Undrafted LB Burfict gets chance with Bengals|work=[[Yahoo! Sports]]|date=May 11, 2012}}</ref> He played [[college football]] at [[Arizona State Sun Devils football|Arizona State]]. Burfict has earned a reputation as a dirty player for multiple incidents throughout his career.<ref>{{cite web| title=Vontaze Burfict, NFL's dirtiest player, gets himself ejected and imitates Johnny Manziel| url=https://www.yahoo.com/amphtml/sports/vontaze-burfict-nfls-dirtiest-player-gets-ejected-192302643.html| accessdate=January 20, 2018| website=yahoo.com| author=Frank Schwab| date=November 12, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| title=Vontaze Burfict, Football's Dirtiest Player, Signs $38.68 Million Extension| url=http://thebiglead.com/2017/09/07/vontaze-burfict-footballs-dirtiest-player-signs-38-68-million-extension/| accessdate=January 20, 2018| website=thebiglead.com| author=Ryan Phillips| date=September 7, 2017}}</ref> He has accumulated $4,150,000 in fines and forfeited salary through his career.<ref>{{cite web| title=Spotrac.com: Vontaze Burfict fines| url=http://www.spotrac.com/nfl/cincinnati-bengals/vontaze-burfict-10100/fines/| accessdate=January 20, 2018| publisher=Spotrac.com}}</ref>
Burfict was considered the most highly ranked football prospect Arizona State ever signed to a [[National Letter of Intent|letter of intent]],<ref>{{Citation |date=February 4, 2009 |title=Arizona State University Football Signs 21 Players to Letters of Intent |url=http://thesundevils.cstv.com/sports/m-footbl/spec-rel/020409aaa.html }}</ref><ref name="BordowEVT">{{Citation |last=Bordow |first=Scott |date=August 15, 2009 |title=Burfict has perfect linebacker philosophy |newspaper=[[East Valley Tribune]] |url=http://www.eastvalleytribune.com/story/143069 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090818193908/http://www.eastvalleytribune.com/story/143069 |archivedate=August 18, 2009 }}</ref> but had an up-and-down career for the [[Arizona State Sun Devils football|Sun Devils]]. An [[2010 College Football All-America Team#Linebacker|All-American in 2010]], Burfict was projected an early first round pick for the [[2012 NFL Draft]] on the eve of his junior season.<ref name="Prisco2012early" /><ref name="Pauline2012early" /><ref name="Reuter2012early" /> However, a mediocre on-field performance and poor pre-draft workouts deteriorated his draft stock. He went on to have a productive rookie season, starting 14 games and leading the team in tackles.<ref name="ESPN Rookie Stats">{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/blog/statsinfo/post/_/id/59227/burficts-impact-on-bengals-is-unmatched|title=Burfict's impact on Bengals is unmatched|publisher=}}</ref>
==High school career== Burfict attended [[Centennial High School (Corona, California)|Centennial High School]] in [[Corona, California]], where he was part of an undefeated Huskies team that won a [[California Interscholastic Federation|CIF]] title, a state championship with the help of quarterback [[Taylor Martinez]], and was ranked second in the nation by ''[[USA Today]]'' in 2008.<ref>{{Citation |date=December 22, 2008 |title=Fort Lauderdale's Aquinas finishes season atop Super 25 |newspaper=USA Today |url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/preps/football/poll/2008-super25.htm }}</ref> That year, Burfict led the Huskies with 159 [[Tackle (football move)|tackles]], two [[quarterback sack]]s, two [[interception]]s and two [[Fumble (American football)|fumble]] recoveries. Burfict participated in the [[US Army All-American Bowl]] and was the third-leading tackler for the West team. He also earned numerous All-American honors, including ''Parade''.<ref>{{Citation |last=O'Shea |first=Michael |date=January 25, 2009 |title=Meet PARADE's All-America High School Football Team |newspaper=Parade |url=http://www.parade.com/news/all-america/2009/parade-all-america-high-school-football-team.html }}</ref>
As a junior, Burfict collected a team-high 130 tackles and added four sacks, two interceptions and one fumble recovery. He helped anchor a linebackers unit that included fellow Sun Devils Shelly Lyons and [[Brandon Magee]]. Corona Centennial finished the 2007 season as No. 24 on ''USA Today‘s'' Top 25.<ref>{{Citation |date=December 26, 2007 |title=Miami Northwestern crowned Super 25 champion |newspaper=USA Today |url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/preps/football/poll/2007-super25.htm }}</ref>
Burfict missed almost all of his sophomore season due to academic problems.<ref>{{Citation |last=Crabtree |first=Jeremy |date=November 4, 2007 |title=Junior LB makes the grades, delivers impact |newspaper=USA Today |url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/recruiting/football/west/2007-10-30-west.htm }}</ref>
He played in the 2009 [[U.S. Army All-American Bowl]]. Considered a five-star recruit by ''[[Rivals.com]]'' and ''[[Scout.com]]'', Burfict was listed as the No. 1 inside linebacker prospect in the nation.<ref>{{Citation |date=January 16, 2009 |title=Rivals.com inside linebackers 2009 |url=http://rivals100.rivals.com/viewrank.asp?ra_key=2128 }}</ref><ref>{{Citation |url=http://recruiting.scout.com/a.z?s=73&p=9&c=4&pid=65&yr=2009 |title=Linebackers 2009 |work=Scout.com }}</ref>
{{College athlete recruit start|40=yes|collapse=no|year=2008}} {{College athlete recruit entry | recruit = Vontaze Burfict | position = [[Linebacker|LB]] | hometown = Corona, California | highschool = [[Centennial High School (Corona, California)|Centennial High School]] (CA) | feet = 6 | inches = 2 | weight = 245 | 40 = 4.6 | commitdate = February 4, 2009 | scout stars = 5 | rivals stars = 5 | espn grade = 85 }} {{College athlete recruit end | 40 = | year = 2009 | rivals ref title = Arizona State Football Commitments | scout ref title = 2009 Arizona State Football Commits | espn ref title = ESPN | rivals school = arizonastate | scout s = 43 | espn schoolid = 9 | scout overall = 1 ([[Linebacker|MLB]]) | rivals overall = 1 ([[Linebacker|ILB]]), 2 ([[California|CA]]) | espn overall = 1 ([[Linebacker|LB]]) | accessdate = 2012-03-17 | bball = }}
==College career== [[File:Vontaze Burfict vs Matt Barkley 2011 3411.jpg|thumb|275px|Burfict (left) pointing at USC Trojans quarterback [[Matt Barkley]] in 2011]] Burfict originally committed to play for the [[Southern California Trojans football|USC Trojans]], but eventually switched to Arizona State on [[National Signing Day]].<ref>{{Citation |last=Sondheimer |first=Eric |authorlink= |date=February 4, 2009 |title=ASU gets big-time recruit in linebacker Burfict |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/sports_blog/2009/02/asu-gets-big-ti.html }}</ref> He joined ASU's 2009 class that included three of his high school teammates.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.statepress.com/archive/node/4268|title=ASU adds wide receiver to recruiting class|accessdate=2012-12-04|date=2009-02-11|work=[[State Press]]|author=Kosmider, Nick}}</ref> By July 2009, he struggled to meet admission standard based on the NCAA eligibility sliding scale and still had one summer school class to complete.<ref>{{Citation |last=Metcalfe |first=Jeff |authorlink= |date=July 18, 2009 |title=HS coach 'relatively optimistic' about Burfict qualifying |newspaper=[[The Arizona Republic]] |url=http://www.azcentral.com/members/Blog/jeffmetcalfe/58058 }}</ref> Sun Devils coach [[Dennis Erickson]], who compared Burfict to [[Ray Lewis]],<ref name="BordowEVT" /> expected him to be academically eligible for enrollment.<ref>{{Citation |last=Metcalfe |first=Jeff |date=August 13, 2009 |title=ASU expects Burfict to be eligible |newspaper=The Arizona Republic |url=http://www.azcentral.com/sports/asu/articles/2009/08/13/20090813asuburfict.html }}</ref> Burfict did qualify on time for the 2010 football season.
By midseason, Burfict ranked second in the team with 30 tackles despite starting only three of six games, and had five tackles for a loss, two sacks, and three pass break-ups. ''[[ESPN]]'' named him Arizona State's midseason defensive MVP.<ref>{{Citation |last=Miller |first=Ted |date=October 20, 2009 |title=Midseason review: Arizona State |work=ESPN.com |url=http://espn.go.com/blog/pac10/post/_/id/4209/midseason-review-arizona-state }}</ref> In a road game against [[2009 Georgia Bulldogs football team|Georgia]] on September 26, Burfict collected a season-high 11 tackles (three solo) and one and half tackles for loss. He led the Sun Devils in tackles in five games over the course of the season. By the end of the year, he had collected 69 tackles, seven tackles for loss, and a pair of sacks, and was named a Freshman All-American by ''[[College Football News]]'',<ref>{{Citation |url=http://cfn.scout.com/2/927274.html |last=Cirminiello |first=Richard |title=2009 CFN All-Freshman Team: Defense & Special Teams |date=December 8, 2009 |work=College Football News |access-date=March 10, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219011540/http://cfn.scout.com/2/927274.html |archive-date=December 19, 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and by the [[Football Writers Association of America]].<ref>{{Citation |url=http://www.sportswriters.net/fwaa/news/2009/allamerica100107.html |title=2009 AON Insurance/FWAA Freshman All-America Team |work=FWAA |date=January 7, 2010 }}.</ref> He was also honored as the [[Pacific-10 Conference]] Defensive Freshman of the Year.
At the start of his sophomore season, Burfict was named First-Team Preseason All-American by ''[[The Sporting News]]''. He was also named to the watchlists of the 2010 [[Rotary Lombardi Award]] and the [[Bronko Nagurski Trophy]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://thesundevils.cstv.com/sports/m-footbl/spec-rel/062210aaa.html |title=ASU's Vontaze Burfict Named First-Team All-American By Sporting News |work=ASU Athletics Football |date=June 22, 2010 }}</ref>
On October 6, 2010, Burfict was benched by Arizona State head coach Dennis Erickson. The reason given was Burfict's unusually high number of personal foul penalties.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.azcentral.com/sports/asu/articles/2010/10/05/20101005arizona-state-football-burfict-benched.html |title=Dennis Erickson takes Vontaze Burfict out of Arizona State starting lineup vs. Washington |first=Jeff |last=Metcalfe |date=October 5, 2010 |newspaper=The Arizona Republic }}</ref> In a game against [[2010 Stanford Cardinal football team|Stanford]], Burfict was called for grabbing the facemask of [[Doug Baldwin]], and—after complaining to the referee—charged with a personal foul for unsportsmanlike conduct that gave Stanford a first down at the ASU 7.<ref>{{Youtube|sjxxWFNJN-U|Highlights: (6) Stanford - ASU}}</ref> Two plays later, Stanford scored what turned out to be the winning touchdown.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.azcentral.com/sports/asu/articles/2010/11/13/20101113asu-vontaze-burfict-mistakes.html |title=ASU football team sees spirited effort derailed by Vontaze Burfict's mistakes |work=The Arizona Republic |date=November 13, 2010 |first=Paola |last=Boivin }}</ref>
Burfict finished the 2010 season with a team leading 90 tackles, 8.5 for a loss, and two forced fumbles. ''[[The Sporting News]]'' selected him to their All-American team, as well as Pacific-10 Defensive MVP.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.azcentral.com/members/Blog/DouglasHaller/110593 |title=Burfict honored as an All-American |work=The Arizona Republic |date=2010-12-15 }}</ref> Burfict is ASU's first 1st team All-American since [[Terrell Suggs]].
With senior cornerback [[Omar Bolden]] lost for the season to a knee injury, Burfict was expected to take over as the leader of the Sun Devils defense in 2011,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.azcentral.com/sports/asu/articles/2011/04/21/20110421asu-football-vontaze-burfict-leader.html |title=ASU's Vontaze Burfict embracing leadership role |newspaper=The Arizona Republic |date=April 21, 2011 |first=Doug |last=Haller }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbssports.com/collegefootball/story/15084294/burfict-timing-arizona-state-can-climb-if-backer-grows-up |title=Burfict timing? Arizona State can climb if 'backer grows up |work=CBS Sports |date=May 20, 2011 |first=Dennis |last=Dodd }}</ref> but eventually had a rather inconsistent junior season. Burfict decided to forgo his senior year at Arizona State and entered the 2012 NFL Draft.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://espn.go.com/nfl/draft2012/story/_/id/7420118/vontaze-burfict-arizona-state-sun-devils-enters-nfl-draft |title=Vontaze Burfict enters NFL draft |work=ESPN |date=Jan 3, 2012 }}</ref>
==Professional career==
===2012 NFL Draft=== When he entered his junior season, Burfict was regarded as one of the best linebackers available in the [[2012 NFL Draft]], projected to go as high as the fifth pick.<ref name="Prisco2012early">{{cite news |url=http://www.cbssports.com/nfl/story/15014424/flash-forward-top-32-picks-for-the-2012-nfl-draft |title=Flash forward: Top 32 picks for the 2012 NFL Draft |date=May 1, 2011 |work=[[CBSSports.com]] |first=Pete |last=Prisco }}</ref><ref name="Pauline2012early">{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2011/football/nfl/05/03/2012.prospects/ |title=Stanford's Luck headlines early look at top 2012 draft prospects |work=Sports Illustrated |date=May 3, 2011 |first=Tony |last=Pauline}}</ref><ref name="Reuter2012early">{{cite news |url=http://www.cbssports.com/nfl/draft/story/15029593/mock-draft-first-look-with-luck-and-heels |title=2012 mock draft: First look with Luck and Heels |work=CBSSports.com |date=May 4, 2011 |first=Chad |last=Reuter }}</ref> Problems on and off the field at Arizona State, however, caused his draft stock to plummet. In October 2011, ''[[Sports Illustrated]]''′s Tony Pauline still ranked him as the No. 20 prospect on his midseason draft board, but noted that he has been "a loose cannon on and off the field, which has raised red flags."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2011/writers/tony_pauline/10/24/top.50/ |title=Andrew Luck, Trent Richardson high in midseason NFL draft rankings |date=October 24, 2011 |work=SI.com |first=Tony |last=Pauline}}</ref>
Burfict entered the [[NFL Combine]] rated as the third best inside linebacker, behind [[Luke Kuechly]] and [[Dont'a Hightower]], but his "disappointing" performance—including a 5.09 sec in the [[40-yard dash]], slowest among linebackers—caused some analysts to project him as a third day (Rd. 4-7) draft pick.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://rob-rang.blogs.cbssports.com/mcc/blogs/entry/13682485/35011522 |title=Lackluster Combine could push Burfict to Day 3 |work=CBS Sports |first=Rob |last=Rang |date=February 27, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2012/writers/don_banks/02/29/combine.awards/index.html?xid=si_nfl |title=Andrew Luck, Stephen Hill, Vontaze Burfict make their mark on NFL combine |first=Don |last=Banks |work=SI.com |date=February 29, 2012 }}</ref> NFL scouts also faulted him for his interview process, in which he blamed the Arizona State coaching staff for his mediocre junior season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bruce-feldman.blogs.cbssports.com/mcc/blogs/entry/31626208/35006810 |work=CBS Sports |first=Bruce |last=Feldman |date=February 27, 2012 |title=Burfict from yellow flags to red ones?}}</ref> Later it was also reported that Burfict tested positive for [[marijuana]] at the combine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/arizona|title=Arizona|first=Fox|last=Sports|publisher=}}</ref>
{{NFL predraft | height ft = 6 | height in = 1¼ | weight = 248 | dash = 5.09 | ten split = | twenty split = | shuttle = | cone drill = | vertical = 30 | broad ft = 9 | broad in = 8 | bench = 16 | wonderlic = | arm span = 31¼ | hand span = 9¾ | note = All values from NFL combine, except BP (ASU Pro Day) }}
At the Arizona State pro day on March 16, Burfict had an "average" performance by his own estimation.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://arizonasports.com/44/1515612/ASU-Pro-Day-Burfict-average-Bolden-100-healthy |title=ASU Pro Day: Burfict 'average', Bolden '100% healthy' |first=Vince |last=Marotta |date=March 16, 2012 |work=Arizona Sports }}</ref> According to ''Sports Illustrated''{{'}}s Tony Pauline, Burfict "looked poorly conditioned and out-of-place in drills".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/web/COM1195540/index.htm|title=Pro Day Tracker|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2012/03/16/vontaze-burfict-bombs-his-pro-day-too/|title=Vontaze Burfict bombs his Pro Day, too|publisher=}}</ref> In their draft coverage, SI.com projected him as 7th round to undrafted.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/football/nfl/draft-2012/players/97974.html |work=CNN |title=Vontaze Burfict}}</ref> Burfict eventually went undrafted, but was signed by the [[Cincinnati Bengals]] as an undrafted free agent.<ref name="Yahoo" />
[[FIle:LB Vontaze Burfict Bengals.jpg|thumb|200px|left|Burfict at Bengals training camp in 2012]]
===2012 season=== An undrafted rookie, Burfict managed to make the Cincinnati Bengals' roster. He played in all 16 games and started 14 of those, finishing the seasons as the Bengals' top tackler with 127 combined tackles, including 18 tackles in their final game of the year against their divisional rival [[2012 Baltimore Ravens season|Baltimore Ravens]]. When Burfict was on field, the Bengals defense allowed 2.4 yards fewer per play, allowing 4.5 compared to 6.9 when he was off the field.<ref name="ESPN Rookie Stats" />
===2013 season=== For incidents that occurred in the 34–30 win over the [[2013 Green Bay Packers season|Green Bay Packers]] in Week 3 of the 2013 season, Burfict was fined a total of $31,000.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap2000000251454/article/vontaze-burfict-fined-31000-for-two-week-3-incidents |title=Vontaze Burfict fined $31,000 for two Week 3 incidents |work=NFL.com |date=September 27, 2013 }}</ref> He had hit a defenseless receiver ([[James Jones (wide receiver)|James Jones]]) and intentionally struck an opponent in the groin ([[Ryan Taylor (American football)|Ryan Taylor]]).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2013/09/27/week-3-nfl-fines-vontaze-burfict-antonio-brown-alex-henery/2884709/ |title=Bengals' Vontaze Burfict racks up $31K in Week 3 fines |newspaper=USA Today |date=September 27, 2013 }}</ref>
Burfict finished the 2013 season leading the NFL in tackles with 171, and was the only Bengals defensive player selected to the Pro Bowl. He was the first Bengals linebacker to make the Pro Bowl since [[Jim LeClair]] in 1976. Burfict also topped the list for the NFL'Performance-Based Pay' program with earning $299,465.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap1000000152307/article/vontaze-burfict-earns-top-figure-in-performancebased-pay|title=Vontaze Burfict earns top figure in 'Performance-Based Pay'|publisher=}}</ref>
===2014 season=== [[File:Vontaze Burfict 2014 Bengals training camp.jpg|thumb|200px|Burfict at 2014 Bengals training camp]] On August 20, 2014, Burfict signed a four-year contract extension with the Bengals.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Coppinger|first1=Mike|title=Vontaze Burfict, Bengals reach long-term extension|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000381250/article/vontaze-burfict-bengals-reach-longterm-extension|website=nfl.com|accessdate=March 10, 2018|date=August 20, 2014}}</ref>
On October 10, 2014, Panthers tight end [[Greg Olsen (American football)|Greg Olsen]] accused Burfict of intentionally trying to injure Olsen and Panthers quarterback [[Cam Newton]] by twisting their ankles after the play was over.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/nfl/story/_/id/11696764/greg-olsen-carolina-panthers-says-vontaze-burfict-cincinnati-bengals-needs-disciplined-post-tackle-tactics|title=Panthers' Olsen: Burfict tried to hurt players|publisher=}}</ref> On October 15, 2014, Burfict was fined $25,000 for twisting ankles on both Newton and Olsen.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/nfl/story/_/id/11705286/nfl-fines-cincinnati-bengals-linebacker-vontaze-burfict-25000 |title=Vontaze Burfict fined $25,000 |author=ESPN News Services|publisher=''ESPN.com''|date=October 15, 2014|accessdate=October 16, 2014}}</ref>
===2015 season=== On December 15, 2015, [[Pittsburgh Steelers]] quarterback [[Ben Roethlisberger]] accused Burfict of having intentionally targeted his ankle in the teams' regular season game on December 13.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbssports.com/nfl/eye-on-football/25414726/ben-roethlisberger-vontaze-burfict-intentionally-dove-at-my-legs|title=Ben Roethlisberger: Vontaze Burfict intentionally dived at my legs|publisher=}}</ref> Burfict was fined for the hit a few days later<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/nfl-shutdown-corner/vontaze-burfict-s-cheap-low-hit-on-big-ben-costs-him-a-heavy-fine-144832644.html|title=Vontaze Burfict's cheap low hit on Big Ben costs him a heavy fine|publisher=}}</ref> and planned to appeal.
On January 9, 2016, in the AFC Wild Card Round against the Steelers, Burfict committed a critical penalty with 18 seconds left in the fourth quarter, when the Bengals were leading Pittsburgh 16-15. Ben Roethlisberger had reentered the game, drove from inside his own 10 yard line, and crossed midfield into Bengals territory. The penalty, which was for an illegal hit to the head on [[Antonio Brown]] after Brown had converted a 4th and 3 for a 1st down into Bengal territory, which together with a second personal foul by [[Adam Jones (American football)|Adam Jones]] positioned Pittsburgh to kick a go-ahead field goal and win the game, 18-16, and advance to the divisional round against the [[Denver Broncos]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vontaze Burfict, Pacman Jones commit two personal fouls to give Steelers game-winner|url = https://www.sbnation.com/2016/1/9/10743832/vontaze-burfict-pacman-jones-awful-personal-fouls-hand-steelers-game|website = SBNation.com|accessdate = 2016-01-10}}</ref> On January 11, the NFL announced that Burfict would be suspended for the first three games of the 2016 season for repeated violations of player safety rules.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/nfl-shutdown-corner/bengals--vontaze-burfict-suspended-first-three-games-of-2016-005521943.html|title=Bengals’ Vontaze Burfict suspended three games, plans to appeal|website=Yahoo.com}}</ref>
===2016 season=== {{expand section|date=January 2018}} After serving a suspension of 3 games to begin the season, Burfict started 11 games in 2016. He participated in 101 tackles, 73 of them individually, had two interceptions for 54 yards, and recovered one fumble.
===2017 season=== On August 28, Burfict was suspended for the first five games of the 2017 regular season due to a hit he made on Chiefs fullback [[Anthony Sherman]] in the second preseason game.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bengals' Vontaze Burfict facing 5-game suspension|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000835920/article/bengals-vontaze-burfict-facing-5game-suspension|author=Orr, Conor|website=NFL.com|date=August 28, 2017}}</ref> On August 30, he appealed, and his suspension was reduced to three games.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict's suspension reduced to three games|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000837222/article/vontaze-burficts-suspension-reduced-to-three-games|website=NFL.com|date=August 30, 2017}}</ref> On September 7, Burfict signed a three-year extension worth $38.68 million with a $3.3 million signing bonus.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict, Bengals agree on 3-year extension|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000840259/article/vontaze-burfict-bengals-agree-on-3year-extension|author=Knoblauch, Austin|website=NFL.com|accessdate=September 7, 2017}}</ref> During Week 7 against the Steelers, Burfict lunged both his feet in the face mask of [[Roosevelt Nix (fullback)|Roosevelt Nix]] before trying to get back up. The scene occurred with 43 seconds of regulation beginning, but no flag was thrown.<ref>{{cite web|title=Surprise, Vontaze Burfict Kicked A Guy|url=https://deadspin.com/surprise-vontaze-burfict-kicked-a-guy-1819766787|publisher=Deadspin|accessdate=October 23, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bengals' Vontaze Burfict may be fined but won't be suspended|url=http://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/21129283/cincinnati-bengals-lb-vontaze-burfict-not-suspended|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=October 23, 2017}}</ref> On October 27, Burfict was fined $12,154.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict fined $12K for kicking Roosevelt Nix|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000868134/article/vontaze-burfict-fined-12k-for-kicking-steelers-fb|publisher=NFL|accessdate=October 27, 2017}}</ref> During Week 10 against the [[Tennessee Titans]], Burfict's troubles continued as he committed two personal foul penalties. The first penalty was a late hit on [[DeMarco Murray]], and the other was unsportsmanlike conduct, where he bumped into an official (although camera footage did not show). Burfict was subsequently [[ejection (sports)|ejected]] for the first time in his NFL career, and left by imitating a celebration taunt by [[Johnny Manziel]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict ejected for contact with official|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000875433/article/vontaze-burfict-ejected-for-contact-with-official|publisher=NFL|accessdate=November 12, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict ejected for making contact with official|url=http://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/21389147/vontaze-burfict-cincinnati-bengals-ejected-first-career|publisher=NFL|accessdate=November 12, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Sessler|first1=Marc|title=Vontaze Burfict won't face ban for flag in Bengals' loss|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000876503/article/vontaze-burfict-wont-face-ban-for-flag-in-bengals-loss|publisher=NFL|accessdate=November 13, 2017}}</ref> Burfict became the victim of a blindside hit by [[JuJu Smith-Schuster]] during [[Monday Night Football]] against the Steelers in Week 13, being carted off the field with a concussion. Smith-Schuster was suspended for one game for the hit.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Patra|first1=Kevin|title=JuJu Smith-Schuster, George Iloka each suspended for one game|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000888604/article/juju-smithschuster-george-iloka-banned-one-game|publisher=NFL|accessdate=December 5, 2017}}</ref>
===2018 season=== On March 16, 2018, Burfict was suspended for four games due to a PED violation.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict facing 4-game suspension for PED violation|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000921745/article/bengals-lb-vontaze-burfict-facing-4game-suspension|publisher=NFL|accessdate=March 16, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict's future with Bengals safe -- for now|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000924144/article/vontaze-burficts-future-with-bengals-safe-for-now|publisher=NFL|accessdate=April 1, 2018}}</ref> On October 20, 2018, during the Bengal's week 6 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers, Burfict was fined $112k for an illegal hit on Antonio Brown which sent him into the NFL's concussion protocol and also resulted in a game-ending head injury to his own teammate.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vontaze Burfict fined $112k for hits vs. Steelers |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000976119/article/vontaze-burfict-fined-112k-for-hits-vs-steelers |publisher=NFL|accessdate=October 21, 2018}}</ref>

==Personal life== Burfict was born in [[South Los Angeles]]. His father, a gang member and convicted [[cocaine]] dealer, was incarcerated most of the time and never had a relationship with his son.<ref name="Dillon SI.com">{{cite news |url=https://www.si.com/more-sports/2012/04/20/vontaze-burfict |title=Burfict working hard to overcome bad reputation, plummeting stock |first=Dennis |last=Dillon |date=April 20, 2012 |work=SI.com }}</ref> His mother, a city transit bus driver, initially raised Burfict and his older half-brother DaShan Miller ({{abbr|b.|born}} 1986) on her own, but eventually remarried and moved to [[Corona, California|Corona]].<ref name="Dillon SI.com" /><ref name="Roenigk ESPN">{{cite news |url=http://espn.go.com/nfl/draft2012/story/_/id/7821147/nfl-asu-linebacker-vontaze-burfict-draft-most-misunderstood-player-espn-magazine |title=ASU linebacker Vontaze Burfict is draft's most misunderstood player |work=ESPN The Magazine |date=April 23, 2012 |first=Alyssa |last=Roenigk }}</ref> Like Burfict, Miller was a football player at Corona Centennial High School, and later played college football at [[UTEP Miners football|UTEP]] and [[Akron Zips football|Akron]].<ref name="Roenigk ESPN" /> Miller was eligible for the [[2010 NFL Draft]], but he went undrafted.
